skill.name: quality-verify
skill.description: Verify the final deliverable meets all quality criteria before delivery. Use as the final validation step to ensure the output meets the user's quality standards across all 6 dimensions.
skill.summary: Verify the final deliverable meets all quality criteria before delivery. Use as the final validation...
skill.author: AbeJitsu

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code, file access, network calls, or system interactions. The SKILL.md file contains only documentation describing how to evaluate deliverables across 6 quality dimensions.

content.value_statement: This skill provides final validation that deliverables meet all quality standards. It evaluates across 6 dimensions and produces a quality score with actionable recommendations. Ensures nothing goes to users without meeting your standards.
actual_capabilities: Calculates overall quality score with weighted averages
Identifies critical, major, and minor issues
Determines if deliverable is ready to ship
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests
Does not access files outside the current context
Does not modify or fix issues automatically
Requires the AI to evaluate based on provided criteria

use_cases.title: Pre-delivery code review
use_cases.description: Validate code, documentation, or features before shipping to ensure they meet team standards.

use_cases.title: Documentation quality gate
use_cases.description: Check documentation for completeness, accuracy, and consistency before publication.

use_cases.title: Quality assessment scoring
use_cases.description: Apply consistent quality criteria across deliverables with objective scoring and reporting.

prompt_templates.title: Basic quality check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use quality-verify to check if my current deliverable meets quality standards. Report the score and any issues found.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed dimension review
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a full quality verification across all 6 dimensions: completeness, correctness, consistency, performance, security, and maintainability.

prompt_templates.title: Standard-based validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify my deliverable against our team quality standards. Load the standards from StandardsRepository and score accordingly.

prompt_templates.title: Ship decision support
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a quality score with clear recommendations. Should I deliver as-is, make minor fixes, or do major revision?

output_examples.input: Use quality-verify to check my React component deliverable
output: Dimension Scores: Completeness 95, Correctness 90, Consistency 88, Performance 85, Security 90, Maintainability 95
Summary: Excellent quality across all dimensions. Component is production-ready.

best_practices: Use this skill as the final step before delivery to catch issues
Review dimension scores to identify specific areas for improvement
Apply the scoring algorithm consistently across all deliverables
anti_patterns: Skipping quality verification when under time pressure
Ignoring minor issues when score is above 80
Not loading project-specific standards for context

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All three tools can invoke quality verification.

faq.question: What is the maximum quality score?
faq.answer: The maximum score is 100. Scores above 85 indicate delivery-ready quality with no critical issues.

faq.question: How does it integrate with my project standards?
faq.answer: The skill uses StandardsRepository to load your project-specific quality criteria and validates against those standards.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no file access, network calls, or code execution. Your data never leaves the context.

faq.question: What if my score is between 60-79?
faq.answer: Scores in this range indicate acceptable quality with minor issues. The skill recommends fixing issues before delivery.

faq.question: How is this different from code review tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides subjective quality assessment across 6 dimensions. It complements automated tools by evaluating completeness and maintainability.
